subject: Re: ant, junit and failure
msgSnippet: Use the errorProperty/failureProperty attributes of the  task instead:
messageBody:
Use the errorProperty/failureProperty attributes of the <junit> task
instead:


<junit printsummary="true"
showoutput="${junit.showoutput}"
errorProperty="junit.failed"
failureProperty="junit.failed"
dir="${unittest.classes.dir}"
fork="yes">
<!-- Stuff omitted -->
</junit>

<junitreport todir="${junit.reports}">
<!-- Stuff omitted -->
</junitreport>

<fail message="Test Cases Failed" if="junit.failed"/>

Ostermueller, Erik wrote:
> You all need to let me know if I'm barking up the wrong mailing list for this.
>
> I'm trying to get all my junit tests in a suite to run, even if there are one or more failures/errors.
> Afterwards, I want the build to fail if there were any failures or errors.
>
> When I added this: haltonerror="yes" haltonfailure="yes"
> to my <junit> tag in my ant file, no tests in my suite run after the first error/failure.
> This also forced me into using a <trycatch> to make sure my <junitreport> runs if there's an error failure :-(.
> If I remove these two attributes, the build doesn't fail if there were errors/failures.
>
> Any suggestions?
>
> Thanks in advance for any help.
>
> Erik O.
